page.title: 04Worship in Alveston
page.content: The old Church was built in Rudgeway.Most people chose for the Church to move with them from Rudgeway to Alveston.People still living in Rudgeway would have preferred the old Church to be rebuilt and not to go to Alveston on Sunday. The Methodist Church and the C of E Church have united services every month.There are two morning services one at the Methodist and one at the C of E.In the evening the services are always joint and revolve from Church to Church.There is a joint Church council with representatives from both Churches which decide important issues involving the Churches.Some members are against the Churches working together because they fear they could lose their identities and traditions.The Churches have joint finances and have fund raising events.
